intro: Silene cryptopetala, commonly known as the ghostflower, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the high alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its delicate, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a short, hairy stem and small, narrow leaves adapted to harsh, cold environments. Its flowers are often hidden beneath a hood-like structure, giving it its common name. Silene cryptopetala is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is considered a species of conservation concern due to its limited distribution and vulnerability to environmental changes.
